newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: European bunkers firm, vigorous demand in Med.
newsitem.headline: European bunkers firm, vigorous demand in Med.

text.p: European bunker prices firmed on Tuesday with substantial buying in the Mediterranean, dealers said.
Rotterdam bunkers were around $92/$93 fob as the barge market pushed up to as high as $92 ex wharf. Some traders said the strength resulted from product shortages.
Trading volume was low. One large enquiry for 10,000 tonnes emerged in the morning, but suppliers said the buyer only took 4,000 tonnes by the close of business.
Total ARA volume was around 10,000 tonnes.
Hamburg prices were steady after sharp increases last week. Some short-term tightness persisted.
Mediterranean fuel oil prices mostly firmed by $1 and gas oil by $2 a tonne. Suppliers in all ports reported healthy business.
Greek supply was again hit, this time by problems at a refinery in the north of the country. Earlier this month, bunker fuel shortages were caused by maintenance at a refinery further south.
"We can only get it drop by drop," one supplier said.
